faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Direct answers to common questions. No sales fluff.

items.question: Why custom pricing instead of fixed?
items.answer: Every AI SaaS has different billing complexity. Some have simple subscriptions, others have complex usage patterns, multi-seat plans, and enterprise contracts. We audit your situation first, then scope the work. You pay for what you need.

items.question: Do I need to pause feature development?
items.answer: No. We build the billing infrastructure in parallel with your team. We need access to your Stripe account, database schema, and a few hours of your team's time for requirements gathering. The rest is on us.

items.question: What if I already have Stripe setup?
items.answer: Great. We build on top of your existing Stripe configuration. The audit will reveal what you have and what is missing. Many companies have Stripe payments but lack usage-based pricing, failed payment recovery, or LLM cost tracking.

items.question: How do you track LLM costs?
items.answer: We implement middleware that intercepts LLM API calls, extracts token usage and model information, and stores it per customer. Supports OpenAI, Anthropic, OpenRouter (400+ models). The data is aggregated and displayed in a margin dashboard.

items.question: What is the edge case coordinator?
items.answer: A 720-line system we built that handles the complex scenarios that break most billing implementations: upgrades/downgrades with proration, trial-to-paid conversions, coupon stacking, annual/monthly switching, and seat-based billing changes. It is the difference between something that works in demo and something that works in production.

items.question: How long does support last after launch?
items.answer: 30 days of post-launch support included. This covers bug fixes, edge case handling, and minor adjustments. After that, you can purchase ongoing support or your team can take over - the code is documented and tested.

items.question: Can you handle enterprise billing requirements?
items.answer: Yes. Enterprise billing often involves custom contracts, negotiated rates, PO-based billing, and net payment terms. We build infrastructure that supports both self-serve and enterprise flows.

items.question: Production-proven infrastructure?
items.answer: Yes. Our infrastructure powers production AI SaaS companies, processing millions of tokens and thousands of billing events monthly. This is not theory - it is battle-tested code.
